beer.beer_description:
To celebrate Beer Cartel's 2025 Advent Calendar, we've doubled up on the call backs by combining two trends that we dabbled in during the early days of MCBC.

This Double Cold IPA starts with a light malt base, fermented using our house lager yeast for a clean, refined body. A huge double dry hop of Cryo Nelson Sauvin from New Zealand provides gooseberries, passionfruit and lychee that is perfect for our warm festive season.

items.badge_description: Put down those cases of Ale Yeast because unlike other IPA styles, the Cold IPA and IPL are brewed with Lager Yeast and a generous amount of hops. When you want a punch of hops with a lighter finish, reach for a Cold IPA or India Pale Lager. That's 5 different beers with the style of IPA - Cold or Lager - IPL (India Pale Lager). Try 5 more or Level 2!

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 465 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 94!

items.checkin_comment: Really hits you. There’s a decent berry hit, some grassy notes, and a decently bitter finish.

user.bio: Alone in quiet places with a bottle and a song
My other half says I'm a beer snob - I'm ok with that. Making mead and the occasional beer at the moment.
Drinky drinky, time for less thinky.

items.checkin_comment: Beer cartel #1. Decent cold IPA here. 8% is a fair start to the box. Can definitely smell the NS on the nose, it’s sweet, pours clean (excuse my not so clean glass). Finishes with passion fruit and a good zing.

user.bio: I like beer tippage. Preferably in my face. Home brewer, my beer is always better.

South of South Austin.  Boat rocker for life. Hey, yo....

items.checkin_comment:
Advent #1. A little late but had to go OS.
Mango, passionfruit and pine with a full, heavy tropical flavour.
